summary: This is a service request from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for technical support to create users and profiles in a NICE Vision system. It indicates ongoing system installation or maintenance at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Assigned to work on the NICE Vision system service request for FBOP MCC New York.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Noted as working on the service request for user and profile creation in the NICE Vision system.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Assigned alongside Jeff Cranor to address the service request.

events.title: Service request for NICE Vision system support
events.description: A priority service request is created for technical assistance in creating users and profiles for a NICE Vision system at FBOP MCC New York.

keyFacts: The document is a service request related to the NICE Vision system at the Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The request is marked as priority P3 (Next Day) and indicates an emergency, requiring a call to a support number the same day.
The issue involves creating users and profiles for a new NICE Vision system installation, suggesting ongoing setup or maintenance of surveillance/recording systems at the facility.
The location (150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007) is the address of the MCC New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.
The date of the request is September 24, 2019, which is after Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating continued facility operations or system upgrades.
